Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2012 05:23PM LoriBeth wrote: Met with my BS....he opted to do a fine needle aspiration biopsy right then...told me I was Birad 4....got the biopsy results yesterday and they were "inconclusive", so scheduled an ultrasound guided biopsy for March 1st.  What I don't understand is how the fine needle biopsy results can be inconclusive??  And I am NOT too happy about the next biopsy not being until March 1st~don't they understand how awful the waiting is for us????  I asked the nurse how come so far away and she said she asked for the first available appt, and that was it.....which for me totally stresses me out!!!!  Is it normal to need more than one biopsy? My BS told me that even if my mass was B9, it would still have to come out...so wouldn't it make more sense to just do a lumpectomy and biopsy that rather than making me go through different biopsies??  This is sooooooooooooooo frustrating and scary!!!!!!!
Posts.Title: Awaiting Excisional Biopsy LoriBeth blg

Posts.Content: Feb 29, 2012 08:50AM LoriBeth wrote: Ultrasound-guided biopsy scheduled for tomorrow morning....but, weather is supposed to be VERY bad with snow and sleet and freezing rain....so wondering if I will be able to get it done...and if not, means rescheduling....not a big fan of that idea~ but, will wait and see what happens I guess.  I have a couple of questions....I just got a copy of my ultrasound report, and it said there was diffuse shadowing in the region of the mass, possible hypoechoic lesions, and the borders of the mass were not well defined.  Now from the reading I've done, this perhaps doesn't sound so good??  Anyone know for sure if these are signs that it IS cancer? Any comments will be very welcome!!!
Posts.Title: Awaiting Excisional Biopsy LoriBeth blg

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2012 06:47AM LoriBeth wrote: B9 B9 B9 B9 B9 B9!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Got my results late yesterday...then was on the phone calling everyone so didn't get a chance to post here!  Thank you all so much for your support~it really helped me get thru this!!!  I will keep checking in here and hope you all will stay in touch!!
Posts.Title: Awaiting Excisional Biopsy LoriBeth blg

Posts.Content: LoriBeth wrote: Just found this site, and I'm really glad I did!  I found a lump in my right breast a couple of weeks ago. I had a mammogram, and an ultrasound done. The radiologist himself came in and did another ultrasound, and told me he found a couple areas of concern.  He spoke with my GP, and I have been referred to a surgeon for a wide excision biopsy.  I am scared to death! I haven't been able to eat much, and sleep is darn near impossible!!  My meeting with the surgeon is on 2/9/12, and then I assume the surgery will be scheduled soon?  I am feeling so many emotions~I am 42 years old, and feel angry, petrified, and in a state of shock that this could even be happening.  I have read some of the posts on here, and I am hoping that some of you that have been through this can give me some advice on how to get through the waiting and the stress. Thanks and God Bless~ Lori Beth Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Awaiting Excisional Biopsy LoriBeth blg

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2012 08:04PM LoriBeth wrote: "Mom" & Wendy~thanks so much for replying!!  It's great to know that I am not alone in this. Finding out you may have breast cancer HAS to be one of the worst things a woman can go through.  And, I agree with you both that the waiting is the worst!!  My mind has been running non-stop about this, and it's hard to make myself focus on something else. I have cleaned, then cleaned, and cleaned some more...lol.  Nights are the worst though~even with the tv on, my mind just goes right back to this.  I wish you both the best of luck~and hope you will keep in touch...we are all in this together!
Posts.Title: Awaiting Excisional Biopsy LoriBeth blg

Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2012 11:53AM LoriBeth wrote: Thank you for answering Marie! This is a scary time for me and it is so helpful to know that there is a lot of support on here!!  I see you are from Rocky Hill....I live in Lebanon...not too far from you!  I'm glad yours was B9!!  There are so many questions and things to be afraid of...but, everyone on here has been so nice, and helpful, and there is a lot of information that has helped me figure out what all the words, etc mean.  So glad I found this site!
Posts.Title: Awaiting Excisional Biopsy LoriBeth blg

Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2012 09:41AM LoriBeth wrote: I really appreciate all the support on here!  The waiting for my next biopsy is really starting to wear on me...night before last I had a dream that they put me to sleep to do the biopsy, and when I woke up from the sedative, they had taken both my breasts and I had nothing but gaping holes where my breasts used to be.  Does anyone else have such horrible dreams??  Scheduled to have the ultrasound-guided biospy on March 1....which seems forever away.  I find myself very angry a lot of the time, and the anxiety meds my PCP gave me just aren't working.  I try to focus on other things, but it's getting harder and harder.  I think that if I just KNEW for sure, then dealing with it would be much easier.  It truly is the fear of the unknown that gets ya!!
Posts.Title: Awaiting Excisional Biopsy LoriBeth blg

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2012 09:32AM LoriBeth wrote: The wait for my results is killing me~ I didn't sleep a wink last night!!  Still in considerable pain from the excisional biopsy, and worried about the results.  I'm supposed to get the results tomorrow...which is my son's 19th birthday....all I can think about is how awful it will be to get bad news!!!  It's going to be a long, horrible day I'm afraid....I just want to scream with frustration!!!!!!!
Posts.Title: Awaiting Excisional Biopsy LoriBeth blg

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2012 10:28AM LoriBeth wrote: Meet with the BS this afternoon....feeling very nervous and scared.  I think I have a good list of questions to ask him though, so hopefully it won't be too stressful in that aspect.  Couldn't sleep last night because my mind kept going back to the possibility that I might have cancer...I'm hoping they don't schedule my biopsy too far out~the waiting is killing me!!
Posts.Title: Awaiting Excisional Biopsy LoriBeth blg

Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2012 10:02AM LoriBeth wrote: They cancelled my ultrasound guided biopsy an hour before I was supposed to be there...apparently the radiologist didn't feel that it would give them enough information....so.....yesterday I had surgery to remove part of the lump.  While I was in getting the wire placed in radiology, we learned that there was blood flow to the mass....does anyone know if this is a bad sign?  Should have the results of the biopsy on the 8th...my son's birthday....hopefully it's not bad news!
Posts.Title: Awaiting Excisional Biopsy LoriBeth blg
